intro: Pouzolzia zeylanica var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
